Services

  • NACOM provides technical and management services to other organizations and projects that address environmental issues and foster responsible management of natural resources climate change adaptations;
  • Undertakes action research to understand the ecological processes, the status and trend of changes of living organisms at species, habitat and ecosystem levels and their linkages to the local people and their livelihood;
  • Organizes training courses, workshops, nature walk, nature camps and promotes nature education;
  • Develops and delivers appropriate and innovative methodology, tools for natural resource and ecological surveys and natural resource management; and
  • Offers capacity building training on natural resource management for project staff, community people and local public representatives.

NACOM’s Specialty

  • NACOM: Values indigenous/traditional knowledge for resource conservation and management;
  • NACOM: Capable of conducting biodiversity baseline surveys and preparing monitoring protocols in huge scale operations with GoB and international donor supported projects.
  • NACOM: Implements projects and programs on Climate Change resilience, Mitigation and Renewable Energy.
  • NACOM: Develops biodiversity conservation management plans for wetlands and ecologically critical areas;
  • NACOM: Addresses gender issues in conservation management programs and livelihood improvements
  • NACOM: Undertakes innovative approach and action for nature conservation and ecological rehabilitation;
  • NACOM: Ensures community participation and community initiatives for resource conservation and management;
  • NACOM: Ensures inclusion of climate change issues in local development planning and interventions; and
  • NACOM: Establishes linkages between poverty and biodiversity conservation to reduce anthropogenic pressure on Natural Resources
